Question Text: What is the probability of drawing an ace from a standard deck of 52 cards?
Two dice are rolled. What is the probability that both dice show a 6?
If the probability of event A is 0.3 and the probability of event B is 0.5. what is the probability of both A and B occurring if they are independent?
The probability of flipping a coin and getting heads is 0.5. What is the probability of getting heads twice in a row?
If two events A and B are independent and P(A)=0.4 and P(B)=0.6. what is P(A and B)?
A box contains 3 red 4 blue and 5 green balls. If two balls are drawn with replacement. what is the probability of drawing a red and then a blue ball?
The probability of drawing a heart from a deck of cards is 1/4. What is the probability of drawing two hearts in a row with replacement?
If a fair die is rolled twice. what is the probability of getting a 3 on the first roll and a 5 on the second roll?
The probability of a student passing a test is 0.7. What is the probability that two students pass their tests?
If the probability of event A is 0.2 and the probability of event B is 0.3. what is the probability of both A and B occurring if they are independent?
A coin is flipped and a die is rolled. What is the probability of getting heads on the coin and a 4 on the die?
If the probability of an event is 0.2. what is the probability that the event does not occur?
A box contains 10 marbles: 3 red 4 blue and 3 green. If one marble is drawn what is the probability that it is either red or blue?
If the probability of rain on Saturday is 0.4 and the probability of rain on Sunday is 0.6 . what is the probability of rain on both days assuming independence?
Two cards are drawn with replacement from a deck of cards. What is the probability of drawing a queen and then a king?
If the probability of drawing an ace from a deck of cards is 1/13 . what is the probability of drawing two aces in a row with replacement?
The probability of rolling a 6 on a fair die is 1/6. What is the probability of rolling two sixes in a row?
A fair coin is flipped three times. What is the probability of getting heads on all three flips?
If the probability of event A is 0.4 and the probability of event B is 0.5. what is the probability of either A or B occurring if they are independent?
Two independent events A and B have probabilities of 0.3 and 0.4 respectively. What is the probability of neither A nor B occurring?
